entry.title: Miners forced to run non-core code in order to get segwit activated
entry.summary: The context provided is related to Bitcoin development and the ongoing efforts to improve the security, scalability, and usability of the network. Bitcoin is a decentralized digital currency that relies on a peer-to-peer network to verify transactions and record them on a public ledger called the blockchain. There are many individuals and organizations involved in Bitcoin development, including open-source developers, companies, and academic institutions.Bitcoin development involves the creation of new technologies and applications that use the Bitcoin network, such as wallets, payment processors, and exchanges. These services have become integral parts of the Bitcoin ecosystem, providing users with convenient ways to store, spend, and trade Bitcoin. The NYA agreement is being fulfilled by the SegWit2x/BTC1 implementation, which is in its final stages. However, the Segwit2MB does not comply with this agreement. The Chinese roundtable statement has indicated that the "NYA" support will be given to the SegWit2x program BTC1, and currently, 80% of miners have set "NYA" in their coinbase string. It seems likely that Segwit activation will happen before August 1st, and if it does, there will be no split on that day. However, if activation happens through Segwit2x and at least some nodes do not follow through with the hard fork after three months, then we will see a split, most probably in September or October. In such uncharted waters, it is uncertain how those two chains will match up and how the split will play out. Therefore, the Segwit2x development team has been asked when a BIP will be ready so that Core can evaluate the technical proposal.The /bitcoin-dev platform mentioned in the context may serve as a forum for developers to share ideas, discuss challenges, and collaborate on projects related to the Bitcoin network. It is unclear what the purpose or content of this platform is beyond that it is likely a communication platform for developers working on the Bitcoin network. The Bitcoin Core software, which is the reference implementation of the Bitcoin protocol, is maintained by a group of volunteer developers. Other popular Bitcoin implementations include Bitcoin Unlimited and Bitcoin XT. Overall, Bitcoin development is a complex and evolving field that requires collaboration and innovation from a diverse range of stakeholders.
